title: Coronation Street's Daniel and Ken look devastated as cast film Sinead's funeral

The Coronation Street cast have been spotting looking downcast as they film Sinead Tinker's heartbreaking funeral scenes.

Terminally ill Sinead passed away during Friday night's emotional episodes after her lengthy battle with cancer.

The Tinkers and the Barlows were inconsolable after Sinead died while husband Daniel read a bedtime story to their baby son Bertie.

The Corrie stars playing Sinead's friends and loved ones were seen filming the funeral scenes in Manchester this weekend.

And it seemed someone upstairs was aware as the heaven's opened on the cast in a torrential downpour.

(Image: MCPIX)

(Image: MCPIX)

Rob Mallard, who plays grieving husband Daniel Osbourne, was spotted arriving at the funeral of his on-screen wife.

While Corrie legend Bill Roache covered up with the hood of his puffa jacket while arriving in the downpour.

Both actors looked understandably glum as they arrived on the set of the funeral.

(Image: MCPIX)

(Image: MCPIX)

Chris Gascoigne, aka Peter Barlow, had a rather unique way of keeping out of the rain as he held his jacket above his head.

He was the only actor in a black suit, while the others appeared to come in colourful outfits as a tribute to Sinead.

Antony Cotton, who plays Sinead's former colleague Sean Tulley, had what looked like a particular jazzy shirt on.

(Image: MCPIX)

(Image: MCPIX)

Daniel Brocklebank was escorted onto the set in Manchester by a crew member holding an umbrella above his head.

Kirk Sutherland actor Andy Whyment, who has been involved in the intense scenes around Sinead's death, looked emotional.

The female cast members also rocked up to filming in their big red jackets.

(Image: MCPIX)

(Image: MCPIX)

Alison Burrows and Lisa George made their way to the funeral together under the same umbrella.

Alison, who plays Sinead's distant mother Arlene Tinker, recently returned to the cast for her on-screen daughter's final episode.

While fan favourite Lisa, better known as Beth Tinker, also made her way to the set for the upsetting scenes.

(Image: MCPIX)

Also on set were some of Sinead's former colleagues at knicker factory Underworld.

Sally Dynevor and Alison King, also known as Sally Metcalfe and Carla Connor, wore black boots when they arrived for filming.

The heartbreaking scenes are set to air in the coming week.s

*Coronation Street airs Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays on ITV at 7.30pm and 8.30pm
description: The Coronation Street cast were spotted filming the heartbreaking scenes in the pouring rain
